content.question: An object of mass <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> collides with an object of mass <math alttext="1 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is at rest, as shown in the figure. A graph of the force as a function of time that the <math alttext="1 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object exerts on the <math alttext="2 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object is shown. After the collision, the <math alttext="2 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object has a speed of <math alttext="2 meters per second " overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="1 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object has a speed of <math alttext="8 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>8</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. A student must determine the initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of the <math alttext="2 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object. Which of the following options shows the correct substitutions into the equation <math alttext="delta vector p equals vector F delta t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover><mtext>Δ</mtext><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> so that the initial speed of the unknown object can be determined?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 kilograms, times open parenthesis, 2 meters per second minus v sub 0, close parenthesis, equals, 8000 Newtons times 0.00125 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>8000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.00125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the maximum force exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object must be considered.

<math alttext="2 kilograms, times open parenthesis, 2 meters per second minus v sub 0, close parenthesis, equals, 8000 Newtons times 0.00125 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>8000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.00125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the average force exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object must be considered.

<math alttext="2 kilograms, times open parenthesis, 2 meters per second minus v sub 0, close parenthesis, equals, 8000 Newtons times 0.00125 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo></mstyle><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>8000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>N</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.00125</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the difference in mass and the maximum force exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object must be considered.

<math alttext="2 kilograms, times open parenthesis, 2 meters per second minus v sub 0, close parenthesis, equals, 8000 Newtons times 0.00125 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>−</mo><mtext>1</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>m/s</mtext><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>8000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.00125</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the difference in mass and the average force exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object must be considered.

content.answer: <math alttext="2 kilograms, times open parenthesis, 2 meters per second minus v sub 0, close parenthesis, equals, 8000 Newtons times 0.00125 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>8000</mn><mtext> </mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>0.00125</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext> </mtext><mtext>s</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, because the average force exerted on the <math alttext="2 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> object must be considered.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
